articles.title: Giants fire veteran manager Bob Melvin after two years as Buster Posey seeks 'different voice' - AP News
articles.description: Manager Bob Melvin has been fired by the San Francisco Giants after the club missed the playoffs for a fourth straight season. Giants President of Baseball Operations Buster Posey had shown his confidence in Melvin by exercising the veteran manager’s contract…

articles.title: Dolphins WR Tyreek Hill suffers a graphic knee injury and is carted off, taken to hospital - Yahoo Sports
articles.description: Hill suffered what looked to be a bad leg injury.

articles.title: Bruce Bochy Will Not Return As Rangers Manager In 2026 - MLB Trade Rumors
articles.description: The Rangers will not be managed by Bruce Bochy in 2026 after the club missed the postseason this year. Read more at MLB Trade Rumors.

articles.title: Hamlin defends last-lap dive on Wallace at Kansas: ‘On Sunday, I am the driver’ - NASCAR.com
articles.description: In the latest episode of his "Actions Detrimental" podcast, Denny Hamlin said he holds no regrets for how he raced Bubba Wallace at Kansas.

articles.title: Nick Sirianni has no question about A.J. Brown’s desire to be an Eagle - NBC Sports
articles.description: Sirianni said he has spoken to Brown about a tweet that seemed to suggest otherwise.

articles.title: After seven seasons, Twins part ways with manager Rocco Baldelli - Star Tribune
articles.description: Rocco Baldelli was the American League manager of the year in his first season with the Twins, but was fired Monday after missing the playoffs in four of the past five seasons.

articles.title: Adonai Mitchell addressed Colts to start Monday’s team meeting - NBC Sports
articles.description: After committing a game-altering fumble out of the end zone in the second half of Sunday’s eventual loss to the Rams, Colts receiver Adonai Mitchell told reporters that his play was “unacceptable.”

articles.title: 2025 MLB Postseason Power Rankings - Covering the Corner
Carlos Mendoza To Return As Mets’ Manager In 2026 - MLB Trade Rumors
articles.description: Despite their stunning collapse, the Mets aren't making a change at manager. Carlos Mendoza will be back in 2026. Read more at MLB Trade Rumors.

articles.title: John Harbaugh: Lamar Jackson was not re-entering the game, his injury precluded it - NBC Sports
articles.description: Harbaugh did not say anything about Jackson's potential availability for Week 5 on Monday, but the QB's injury was significant enough to sideline him on Sunday.

articles.title: Myles Garrett on Lions run offense: They’re gritty and tough, hats off to them - NBC Sports
articles.description: Lions offensive coordinator John Morton got some notice last week when he said "I don't think they've seen a running game like ours" when he was asked about the Browns allowing the fewest rushing yards in the league through the first three games.

articles.title: Giants co-owner Mara being treated for cancer - ESPN
articles.description: Giants co-owner John Mara announced Monday that he recently was diagnosed with cancer and is following the treatment plan recommended by his doctors.

articles.title: Nnamdi Madubuike’s Season Is Over, Long-Term Questions Linger - Baltimore Ravens
articles.description: Head Coach John Harbaugh said Nnamdi Madubuike will be the person to address his long-term prognosis.

articles.title: Rickie Collins, Fran Brown rewatched Duke loss immediately after game: ‘He’s who we need at quarterback’ - Syracuse.com
articles.description: Collins called Brown after the loss to Duke, and the two spent most of the night together at the Lally complex.
